Docs.summary: Android magnifier widget.

remarks.para: Android magnifier widget. Can be used by any view which is attached to a window.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsClippingEnabled As Boolean
public: property bool IsClippingEnabled { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns whether the magnifier position will be adjusted such that the magnifier will be fully within the bounds of the main application window, by also avoiding any overlap with system insets (such as the one corresponding to the status bar) i.
Docs.value: whether the magnifier position will be adjusted

remarks.para: Returns whether the magnifier position will be adjusted such that the magnifier will be fully within the bounds of the main application window, by also avoiding any overlap with system insets (such as the one corresponding to the status bar) i.e. whether the area where the magnifier can be positioned will be clipped to the main application window and the system insets.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Position As Point
public: property Android::Graphics::Point ^ Position { Android::Graphics::Point ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the top left coordinates of the magnifier, relative to the main application window.
Docs.value: the top left coordinates of the magnifier

remarks.para: Returns the top left coordinates of the magnifier, relative to the main application window. They will be determined by the coordinates of the last #show(float, float) or #show(float, float, float, float) call, adjusted to take into account any potential clamping behavior. The method can be used immediately after a #show call to find out where the magnifier will be positioned. However, the position of the magnifier will not be updated visually in the same frame, due to the async nature of the content copying and of the magnifier rendering. The method will return null if #show has not yet been called, or if the last operation performed was a #dismiss.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Sub Show (sourceCenterX As Single, sourceCenterY As Single)
public: void Show(float sourceCenterX, float sourceCenterY);
public void Show (float sourceCenterX, float sourceCenterY);
.method public hidebysig instance void Show(float32 sourceCenterX, float32 sourceCenterY) cil managed

Docs.param: horizontal coordinate of the source center, relative to the view
vertical coordinate of the source center, relative to the view
Docs.summary: Shows the magnifier on the screen.

remarks.para: Shows the magnifier on the screen. The method takes the coordinates of the center of the content source going to be magnified and copied to the magnifier. The coordinates are relative to the top left corner of the magnified view. The magnifier will be positioned such that its center will be at the default offset from the center of the source. The default offset can be specified using the method Builder#setDefaultSourceToMagnifierOffset(int, int). If the offset should be different across calls to this method, you should consider to use method #show(float, float, float, float) instead.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Sub Show (sourceCenterX As Single, sourceCenterY As Single, magnifierCenterX As Single, magnifierCenterY As Single)
public: void Show(float sourceCenterX, float sourceCenterY, float magnifierCenterX, float magnifierCenterY);
public void Show (float sourceCenterX, float sourceCenterY, float magnifierCenterX, float magnifierCenterY);
.method public hidebysig instance void Show(float32 sourceCenterX, float32 sourceCenterY, float32 magnifierCenterX, float32 magnifierCenterY) cil managed
member this.Show : single * single * single * single -> unit

Docs.param: horizontal coordinate of the source center relative to the view
vertical coordinate of the source center, relative to the view
horizontal coordinate of the magnifier center, relative to the view
vertical coordinate of the magnifier center, relative to the view
Docs.summary: Shows the magnifier on the screen at a position that is independent from its content position.

remarks.para: Shows the magnifier on the screen at a position that is independent from its content position. The first two arguments represent the coordinates of the center of the content source going to be magnified and copied to the magnifier. The last two arguments represent the coordinates of the center of the magnifier itself. All four coordinates are relative to the top left corner of the magnified view. If you consider using this method such that the offset between the source center and the magnifier center coordinates remains constant, you should consider using method #show(float, float) instead.

format.a: Java documentation for android.widget.Magnifier.show(float, float, float, float).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SourcePosition As Point
public: property Android::Graphics::Point ^ SourcePosition { Android::Graphics::Point ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the top left coordinates of the magnifier source (i.
Docs.value: the top left coordinates of the magnifier source

remarks.para: Returns the top left coordinates of the magnifier source (i.e. the view region going to be magnified and copied to the magnifier), relative to the window or surface the content is copied from. The content will be copied: - if the magnified view is a SurfaceView, from the surface backing it - otherwise, from the surface backing the main application window, and the coordinates returned will be relative to the main application window The method will return null if #show has not yet been called, or if the last operation performed was a #dismiss.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Update() cil managed

Docs.summary: Asks the magnifier to update its content.

remarks.para: Asks the magnifier to update its content. It uses the previous coordinates passed to #show(float, float) or #show(float, float, float, float). The method only has effect if the magnifier is currently showing.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float Zoom { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.Zoom : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns the zoom to be applied to the magnified view region copied to the magnifier. -or- Sets the zoom to be applied to the chosen content before being copied to the magnifier popup.
Docs.value: the zoom applied to the content

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:

Returns the zoom to be applied to the magnified view region copied to the magnifier. If the zoom is x and the magnifier window size is (width, height), the original size of the content being magnified will be (width / x, height / x).
Property setter documentation:
Sets the zoom to be applied to the chosen content before being copied to the magnifier popup. The change will become effective at the next #show or #update call.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
